Art. 4.186. 
Wills of military personnel 
Wills of military personnel and persons employed in the armed forces may, in any country whatsoever, be received by an officer of the rank of major, or by any other officer of a higher rank, in the presence of two witnesses, or by two officers in charge of the personnel administration of the unit to which the military personnel or person concerned belongs, or by one of these officers in the presence of two witnesses.
They may also, if the testator is ill or injured, be received by the doctor in charge of medical support for the unit to which the soldier or person concerned belongs, assisted by the officer in charge of personnel administration.
Paragraphs 1 and 2 only apply to those who are on military expedition, or in quarter, or in garrison outside Belgian territory or prisoners of the enemy. They do not apply to those who are in quarters or in garrison in the interior, unless they are in a besieged place or in a citadel and other places whose gates are closed and communications interrupted because of the war.
These wills become null and void six months after the testator has returned to a place where he is free to use the ordinary forms.
